statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: DeVon Baker scored 27 points to help UNC Asheville beat NAIA St. Andrews 87-47 on Thursday night for Mike Morrell's first career win as a head coach.
article.headline: Baker, UNC Asheville beat NAIA St. Andrews 87-47
article.linkText: Baker, UNC Asheville beat NAIA St. Andrews 87-47
article.story: ASHEVILLE, N.C. -- DeVon Baker scored 27 points to help UNC Asheville beat NAIA St. Andrews 87-47 on Thursday night for Mike Morrell's first career win as a head coach. Baker was 8-of-15 shooting, including 2 of 3 from 3-point range, grabbed six rebounds and had three steals. Tajion Jones added 14 points and four assists and Coty Jude scored 11 for the Bulldogs, who won their season opener for the first time since the 2012-13 season. Jude hit a 3-pointer to give UNC Asheville a 5-3 lead and the Knights trailed the rest of the way. Baker made a layup and Jones came up with a quick steal and layup that pushed the lead into double figures for good midway through the first half. The Bulldogs used its 18-2 advantage on the offensive glass to outscore St. Andrews 20-0 in second-chance points and outscored the Knights 22-3 in points off turnovers. Isaac Clay and Luis Rossi led St. Andrews with eight points apiece.
